Name: Providing for the activation of parking meters on Sundays in certain commercial areas.
Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to providing for the activation of parking meters on Sundays in certain commercial areas.

History.Description: This Introduction was Introduced by Council
This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Transportation
This Introduction was Sine Die (Filed, End of Session)

Text:
Be it enacted by the Council as follows:
 
Section 1.  Section 19-167 of the administrative code of the city of New York, as added by local law of 2005 is amended to read as follows:
§19-167 Suspending the activation of parking meters on Sundays; activation of parking meters on Sundays in certain commercial areas.  a.  Notwithstanding any other provision of law, but subject to the provisions of paragraph b of this section, no person parking a vehicle at a parking meter is required to activate such meter on a Sunday and no notice of violation or summons may be issued solely for the failure to activate such parking meter on a Sunday.  
b.  Notwithstanding the provisions of subdivision a of this section to the contrary, the department may promulgate rules eliminating the suspension of the requirement to activate a parking meter on a Sunday contained in subdivision a of this section, for parking meters on streets or sidewalks immediately adjacent to all, or any portion of a zoning district designated C4, C5, C6, C7 or C8 in the New York City zoning resolution, or in all, or any portion of, a business improvement district established pursuant to chapter four of title twenty-five of this code upon a determination that the suspension of such requirement would serve the commercial interests of such area or district or portion thereof.
§2.  This local law shall take effect immediately.
PH
Int 759/2005
